title: Mexico charges 4 soldiers with killings in Nuevo Laredo
description: Mexican prosecutors formally presented homicide charges against four soldiers implicated in the Feb. 26 shooting deaths of five men in the border city of Nuevo Laredo

title: Egypt secretly planned to supply rockets to Russia, leaked U.S. document says
description: President Abdel Fatah El-Sisi in February planned to produce 40,000 rockets for Russia and instructed officials to keep production and shipment secret “to avoid problems with the West.”

title: 3 killed, 2 injured at corner store in southern Puerto Rico
description: Police in Puerto Rico say three people have died and two others were injured during a shooting

title: Mexico migrant protest sees brief closing of El Paso bridge
description: A protest by some migrants led U.S. Customs and Border Protection to briefly close the Paso Del Norte International Bridge linking El Paso, Texas and the Mexican border city of Ciudad Juarez

title: How U.S. friends and foes have responded to leaked Pentagon documents
description: The Pentagon is working “around-the-clock” to determine the scope of any leaked material and the impact its spread could have, a Pentagon spokesman said.

title: As summer heat looms, Japan urged to curb impact, emissions
description: Temperatures are rising in Japan and summer is coming fast

title: A short Biden trip to N. Ireland, where peace clashes with dysfunction
description: The president will celebrate the anniversary of the Good Friday peace agreement. He won't address the Northern Ireland Assembly, because it has broken down.

title: Mexican ballad singer Julián Figueroa dies at 27
description: Mexican ballad singer Julián Figueroa has died at the age of 27, his mother confirmed Monday

title: The virus hunters
description: A journey into the wild world of high-risk virus hunting, a coming reckoning, and The Post’s year-long investigation into the U.S. role in pushing such research to the edge.

title: Saudi diplomat: Talks with Houthis aim to revive Yemen truce
description: Saudi Arabia’s ambassador to Yemen says his trip to the Houthi-held capital of Sanaa was aimed at reviving a cease-fire and re-starting political talks to end the nine-year conflict

title: Military: Syria rocket attack on US base nets no casualties
description: The U.S. military says a rocket attack has targeted a base in eastern Syria housing American troops causing no injuries or damage

title: Brazil's Lula struggling to move forward after 100 days
description: Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva finishes the first 100 days of his third term as Brazil’s president on Monday and his return to power has been marked by efforts to reinstate his past social policies and undo his predecessor’s legacy

title: What we’ve learned from the leaked Pentagon documents
description: The sensitive subject matter and relative recency are major worries for U.S. officials.

title: Separatist Indian movement’s Twitter bots spread violent messages
description: Backers of the Khalistani movement are using multiple networks of linked accounts to blast out videos and calls for action simultaneously, before Twitter’s reduced safety staff can respond.

title: Israeli PM retracts firing of defense minister amid tension
description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has retracted his decision to fire his defense minister over criticism of the government’s contentious plan to overhaul the judiciary

title: Vladimir Kara-Murza condemns Russian treason case
description: Longtime critic of President Vladimir Putin, facing up to 25 years in jail, tells judge that the war in Ukraine is the crime.

title: King Charles’s coronation: 2 carriages, 5 swords and a crown emoji
description: The procession route will be shorter than the one Queen Elizabeth II took. But there will still be lots of pomp at the May 6 ceremonies.

title: Ethiopia: Aid group says 2 workers killed amid violence
description: An aid group says two of its workers have been killed in Ethiopia’s Amhara region

title: Dalai Lama apologizes for asking boy to ‘suck my tongue’ at temple
description: His office says the 87-year-old Dalai Lama ‘often teases people he meets in an innocent and playful way’ but ‘regrets the incident’ caught on video.

title: Historic Mexico City rock and counterculture hub closes
description: After 27 years, the Multiforo Cultural Alicia in Mexico City has closed its doors _ marking the end of an era

title: Mountain teams in Slovenia rescue climbers stuck in the Alps
description: Slovenia’s emergency mountain teams say they have rescued four French citizens who were stuck in bad weather in the Alps

title: Bomb targeting Pakistani police in SW kills 4, wounds 15
description: A government spokesman says a roadside bomb targeting a police vehicle in volatile southwestern Pakistan has killed at least four people and wounded 15 others

title: UN food agency: $800m urgently needed for Afghanistan
description: The U.N. food agency says it urgently needs $800 million for the next six months to help Afghans, with the country at the highest risk of famine in a quarter of a century

title: Pope renews call to pray for peace celebrating Easter Monday
description: Pope Francis renews his call to pray for peace on Easter Monday, celebrating the Regina Coeli prayer in St. Peter’s Square

title: 7 electricity pylons collapse onto highway in South Africa
description: At least seven large electricity pylons have collapsed onto a highway near the South African capital of Pretoria and caused a multiple-vehicle crash

title: 2 dead, 20 missing as migrant boat sinks off Tunisia
description: German aid group ResQship says at least two migrants have died and about 20 others are missing after their boat sank in the Mediterranean Sea between Tunisia and Italy

title: Ethiopian plan to disarm regional forces sparks protests in Amhara
description: The disarmament plan triggered sporadic clashes in Ethiopia's Amhara region, where some residents fear it might leave them vulnerable to ethnic attacks.

title: Taliban ban restaurant gardens for families, women in Herat
description: The Taliban have banned families and women from restaurants with gardens or green spaces in Afghanistan’s northwestern Herat province

title: Dalai Lama apologizes after video shows him kissing boy
description: Tibetan spiritual leader the Dalai Lama has apologized after a video showing him kissing a child on the lips triggered criticism

title: Romanian prosecutors search devices in Andrew Tate case
description: Romanian prosecutors have carried out forensic searches of electronic devices in the case of Andrew Tate, the divisive internet personality who is under house arrest on suspicion of organized crime and human trafficking, his lawyer says

title: Research with exotic viruses risks a deadly outbreak, scientists warn
description: The covid-19 epidemic has challenged conventional thinking about biosafety, leading a growing number of scientists to reconsider the danger of prospecting for unknown viruses and other research with pathogens.

title: Avalanche kills 6, including mountain guides, in French Alps
description: French local authorities say the death toll from Sunday’s avalanche in the French Alps has risen to six, including two mountain guides

title: In Ukrainian village, a family lives under cloud of shelling
description: Ten-year old Khrystyna Ksenofontova spends her days caring for cats and studying while living under a cloud of shelling

title: France: 2 bodies found after Marseille building collapse
description: Authorities say two bodies were found overnight in the rubble following an explosion that collapsed a building in the southern French city of Marseille

title: China jails human rights activists for years over private gathering
description: Ding Jiaxi and Xu Zhiyong were tried behind closed doors for “subversion of state power” amid a crackdown on activism.

title: Tesla to open battery factory in Shanghai as China seeks foreign investment
description: Elon Musk, Tesla’s CEO, said the factory will supplement another in California. The batteries are touted as a solution to avoid outages and stabilize power grids.

title: Lebanon still proxy battleground, 50 years after Israel raid
description: It was a cold night 50 years ago when an Israeli commando team led by a man disguised as a woman infiltrated a posh Beirut neighborhood and shot and killed three top officials from the Palestine Liberation Organization in their apartments

title: Ukraine live briefing: Counteroffensive preparations underway in Ukraine; pope calls for peace
description: Leaked U.S. intelligence documents indicate a shortfall of Western-supplied weaponry, raising concerns about Ukraine’s ability to lead a counteroffensive.

title: As spring offensive nears, Ukraine is drafting reinforcements
description: After 13 months of war and a bloody winter, Ukraine needs more soldiers — and fast. New rules have made it easier for officials to issue draft notices.

title: China’s new world order is taking shape
description: A bumper week for diplomacy in Beijing helps show the contours of the new world order China is imagining.
